	Knowledge of procurement regulations and vendor compliance is a plus

	We are seeking a qualified and diligent Accountant to join our finance team in Lekki / Ajah. The ideal candidate will be reliable, detail-oriented, and able to manage accounting tasks with minimal supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records (journals, ledgers, trial balance)

	Reconcile bank statements and intercompany accounts
	Manage accounts payable and accounts receivable

	Monitor and manage petty cash, general ledger accounts, and accruals
	Perform other accounting tasks as assigned by the Finance Manager / Head of Finance


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Professional accounting qualification (e.g. ICAN, ACCA, ACA) is a plus
	Minimum 2-4 years of relevant accounting experience
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, tax, and regulatory requirements in Nigeria
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables)
	Attention to detail, accuracy, and integrity
	Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) coverage
	Competitive salary (negotiable based on experience)
	Opportunity for growth and professional development
	Friendly and supportive work environment.


Method of Application

Accountant Job at PWAN Group




        
    

        
        PWAN Group is a leading real estate investment and network marketing company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing affordable housing solutions and lucrative investment opportunities. With a strong presence nationwide, we pride ourselves on excellence, integrity, and customer satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Locations: Ajah, Lekki - Lagos and Asaba - Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description

	We are seeking a qualified and diligent Accountant to join our finance team in Lekki / Ajah. The ideal candidate will be reliable, detail-oriented, and able to manage accounting tasks with minimal supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records (journals, ledgers, trial balance)
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports
	Reconcile bank statements and intercompany accounts
	Manage accounts payable and accounts receivable
	Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations, statutory filings, and audit requirements
	Liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory bodies
	Monitor and manage petty cash, general ledger accounts, and accruals
	Perform other accounting tasks as assigned by the Finance Manager / Head of Finance


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Professional accounting qualification (e.g. ICAN, ACCA, ACA) is a plus
	Minimum 2-4 years of relevant accounting experience
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, tax, and regulatory requirements in Nigeria
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables)
	Attention to detail, accuracy, and integrity
	Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) coverage
	Competitive salary (negotiable based on experience)
	Opportunity for growth and professional development
	Friendly and supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@pwangroup.com using “Accountant Lekki/Ajah”or "Accountant Asaba” as the subject of the email.
